metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13032 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The RADIUS parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read inprint-radius.c:print_attr_string().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
